summary: Eton College is a famous boys' boarding school in England, founded in 1440 by King Henry VI. It is one of the oldest and most expensive schools in the country, charging around Â£52,749 per year. Many important people have gone to Eton, including prime ministers, world leaders, and famous actors. The school is known for its rich history and traditions. Unlike many other schools, Eton remains a boys-only boarding school, with students living there seven days a week during term time.
title: Eton College
